name: Rialto Bridge
description: The oldest and most famous bridge spanning the Grand Canal. Perfect spot for photos and watching gondolas pass by.
tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds. Best photos from the nearby fish market.

name: St. Mark's Basilica
description: Stunning Byzantine cathedral with golden mosaics and incredible architecture. A must-see in Venice.
tips: Book tickets online to skip the long queues. Dress modestly (covered shoulders and knees).

name: Doge's Palace
description: Gothic palace that was the residence of the Doge of Venice. Includes the famous Bridge of Sighs.
tips: Combined ticket with St. Mark's saves money. Secret Itineraries tour is worth it.

name: Osteria Al Squero
description: Hidden gem! Tiny local bar with amazing cicchetti (Venetian tapas) and spritz. Locals' favorite spot.
tips: Stand outside by the canal for the best atmosphere. Try the baccalà mantecato.

name: Libreria Acqua Alta
description: Unique bookshop where books are stored in bathtubs and gondolas to protect from flooding. Instagram-worthy!
tips: Don't miss the staircase of books in the back courtyard. Great for photos.

name: Trattoria Al Gazzettino
description: Authentic Venetian restaurant away from tourist traps. Family-run with incredible seafood pasta.
tips: Reservation recommended. Try the spaghetti alle vongole and tiramisu.

name: Scala Contarini del Bovolo
description: Hidden spiral staircase offering panoramic views of Venice. Most tourists miss this gem!
tips: Small entrance fee but worth it for the views. Tucked away in a quiet courtyard.

name: Burano Island
description: Colorful island famous for its brightly painted houses and lace-making tradition.
tips: Take vaporetto line 12. Best photos in the morning light. Try the local bussolà cookies.
